meanings.definition: Catch in or as in a trap
meanings.sent1: The spider tried to ensnare the fly in its web.
meanings.sent2: The hunter set up a trap to ensnare the wild animal.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox managed to ensnare the clumsy rabbit in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her captivating smile seemed to ensnare everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody of the music seemed to ensnare the audience in a trance.

meanings.sent1: He didn't want to ensnare his friends in his problems.
meanings.sent2: The risky decision could ensnare him in a web of troubles.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once might ensnare you in a mess.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events could ensnare her in a complicated situation.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the warning signs could ensnare you in a sticky situation.

meanings.definition: To entangle in or as in a net
meanings.sent1: The fisherman managed to ensnare a big catch in his net.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the tree seemed to ensnare the kite as it flew by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to ensnare its tail in a loop of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to ensnare him in a web of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plot of the story seemed to ensnare the readers in its twists and turns.
